body.name: hp Newest Essential 15 Laptop, 16GB RAM, 640GB(128GB SSD+512GB USB), 15.6" Anti-Glare Display, Intel Quad-Core Processor, Office 365 1-Year, Upto 11hrs Battery, Type-C, Fast Charging, Win11S, JVQ mp
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 15 hrs 34 mins
features: 【PERFECTLY PRICED】 Benefit from enhanced multitasking capabilities with 16GB of DDR4 RAM, which helps you accomplish everyday computing tasks so you can stay in your flow. 128GB SSD+ 512GB USB storage, offering up to 15 times faster performance compared to traditional hard drives, which is ideal for ultra-compact PCs needing an energy-efficient but high- performance internal storage solution.
【BUILT FOR THE SPEED OF LIFE】 Harness the power of the Intel N200 (Pentium), featuring 4 cores and 4 threads with a clock speed up to 3.7GHz with turbo boost and a 6MB cache.

【A WHOLE NEW WORLD】 Get lost in a remarkable entertainment experience as the display delivers crisp quality and a 84% screen-to-body ratio for enhanced viewing. See your digital world in a new way with 1 million pixels in the micro-edge, flicker-free HD display.
【CONNECT ON YOUR TERMS】 Video chat in vibrant clarity with a high quality True Vision camera you can close when not in use and microphone mute key, keeping you safe online.

【BRING YOUR IDEAS TO LIFE 】 One year subscription of Microsoft 365 apps including Word, Excel and PowerPoint also feature smart assistance to help make your writing more readable, your data clearer, and your presentations more visually powerful.
body.description: Processor: Intel Pentium N200 4 Cores (4T up to 3.7 GHz, 6 MB)Graphics: Integrated Intel UHD GraphicsOperating system: Windows 11 Home in S Mode Memory: 16 GB DDR4-3200 MHzHard Drive: 128GB SSD and HP P500 512GB USB Optical Drive: NoneDisplay: 15.6" diagonal, HD (1280 x 720), BrightView, 250 nits Ports: 2 x USB 3.1 Type-A (5Gbps signalling rate)1 x USB 3.1 Type-C (5Gbps signalling rate)1 x HDMI 1.4 b1 x Headphone/mic combo1 x AC smart pin Connectivity: Realtek Wi-Fi 6 and Bluetooth 5.3Audio: Dual speakers Keyboard: Standard Numeric Keyboard , EnglishBuilt-in Webcam: HP True Vision 720p HD camera with integrated dual array digital microphones Battery: 3-cell, 41 Wh Li-ion, Up to 9 hours and 45 minutesColor: Sliver Dimensions L x W x H (inches): 14.11 x 9.52 x 0.78Weight: 3.83lbs

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars So far, so good - better than my old Win 10 hp
reviews.reviewText: Fast, of course, because it's new. A few disappointments and annoyances, but nothing monumental. The hard internet connection is through a "standard" USB port so you loose one of only 2 of those if you don't want to use wifi. (You may have to buy an internet cable adapter if you don't have a USP end on your cable - $10 from amazon, $20 from a brick and mortar.) You may need a USB extender adapter if you hard connect your printer or you use a remote keyboard/mouse with a USB receiver. There is one USB/c port. No optical drive or dedicated card reader ports. Poor contrast between key color and printed characters - white on grey. Power-on key now on right "hidden" among function keys - a bit of a p.i.t.a. until I stuck some red electrical tape on it Small SSD hard drive (128 GB) supplemented with 512 GB USB flash drive, so there goes one USB port. (Total of .64 TB.) So for speed, more RAM, light weight and slim profile you loose a fair amount of versatility and internal HD space. But I have an external optical drive, multi-card reader, twice the RAM now and a number of flash drives so I'm not going to miss my old laptop, which died on me anyway, too much - other than the software, some of which I've recovered already. As I get used to the new laptop, and keep loading new apps, I probably will come to love it as much as my old one. But right now I really don't. Would I buy it again? Very likely - I like the 15" screen and very packable light weight, the longer lasting battery and the speed. which I will no doubt come to appreciate even more since I am traveling internationally again after nearly a decade of static retirement.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I wanted.
reviews.reviewText: I use my laptop every day and have been successful in everything I've wanted to do. It is just the right weight and size for my 70 year old eyes. I recommend those to eveyone..

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Not what you'd expect from Modern Technology
reviews.reviewText: I chose this item because the memory capacity was double that of a same priced HP item. I probably shoud have looked closer at the features.There is NO touchscreen. The touch pad sticks and you need to manipulate it to get it to click where you want. When you 'pinch' the screen open it's a fight... it will expand and then shrink if you attempt to expand it a little more. Very time consuming to operate.The "ON" button is on the top row of "F" keys, and not a separate button not near any other keys so you can 'feel for it". You need to have a light on or be in daylight to find the key, unless you memorize how many keys from the right the on key sits.I've had this device for about a week and find I use more time than any extra memory may be worth. I would NOT recommend this item... check the features on one will less internal memory, but the modern features you expect. Not having touch screen is a huge step backwards.
